title: Thunderbird calendar: deleted events (single occurrence of repeating event) reappear after a while or after exit/start
content:
I'm running Thunderbird 115.15.0 on Ubuntu 24.04. I have a recurring event that was initiating by an outside invitation. If I try to delete a single occurrence, by any means, it always reappears after a while. It disappears from the calendar and from the "Events this month" pane, but reappears after a while or immediately after starting thunderbird. "By any means" includes when the event initiator sends a cancellation notice and the cancellation is accepted, using the delete key from the "events" pane, using the delete key when clicking on the item in the calendar, or right clicking on the item in the calendar and finding one's way to "delete only this occurrence". This is making the calendar almost useless. This is a purely local thunderbird; I've never tried Caldav or whatever.

(On a 2nd matter, why do not of the "topics" for asking a question on this forum relate to my question?)
creator: petersbk

title: Thunderbird Columns
content:
I just bought a new computer and installing all the programs, of which is Tbird. The old one shows my prefered view, which includes the columns: (Subject; Read; Correspondents; Junk; Date; Attachment; and starred.)

I just downloaded the newest version of Tbird and installed it on the new computer. I am almost done copying settings, but I cannot get the new computer to let me "view" the columns. I cannot find that setting - and BOTH of the computers show version 128.3.1esr(64-bit). I have searched all of the forums, and everything that is posted about displaying the columns - so up-to-date at 2017. UG! (SO annoying that information on the web is out of date and never updated or eliminated when software or procedures change, only to make the searcher - me - wasting tons of time looking at worthless information! No, this is not just you. It is everything on the web - so much out of date information.)

Thanks for your help. I really want my columns back. (It really helps in doing searches when you use them to quickly sort by clicking on the column).

content:

Il mio css è

  1. unifiedToolbarContainer, #unifiedToolbar, #titlebar-buttonbox-container {background: #757575; color: white !important;}
  2. toolbar-menubar {background: #949494; color: white !important;}

tabs-toolbar { 

 order: 3;  color: white!important;

}

Che dovrei cambiare? What should I change to get a white text in tabs?

title: Always displaying the same email
content:
Hello We are a technical service and we have clients with Thunderbird, for many years

We are encountering a very strange thing and we cannot find the problem

We have several accounts and it only happens with one account

It does not always happen, and it is random,

When you open an email, content from another email appears, and you open another email and the same content always appears, the strange thing is that it is not all the emails, but some. The only way I have found is to delete the account and download it from the server again I have come to the conclusion that maybe an email is wrong and does this, but no matter how many times you close the program and open it again it continues to fail.

We have already deleted the account for the same client several times in 2 months, but after a while it happens again

At this point I am considering changing the program, because we do not know why it does this

Thank you very much for your help

title: Thunderbird recurring problem - Incoming mails are "mixed up"
content:
hello!

I am struggling with a problem with the newest version of Thunderbird running on Windows 11 and one IMAP mailbox. Thunderbird was running fine for at least a year however some months ago, I guess after an update but dont know for sure, weird stuff started happening: Incoming mails where "mixed up" so clicking on mails opened different mails, mails that certainly had attachments where shown not to have attachments and sometimes mails where shown in raw source code form instead of properly rendered with formatting and just the mail text etc. I didnt really find anything searching around for those symptoms on the Internet, but it seemed like something was damaged so I right clicked the inbox folder and repaired it and the problems seemed to be gone for 1-2 weeks, however now they are back. Is this known and how to get to the bottom of this? Thanks for any help and suggestions.

thanks, Paul

title: Thunderbird 115.16.0esr (64-bit) outgoing email not working
content:
Current OS is Linux Mint 21.3 Cinnamon, and until October 2024 I've successfully used Thunderbird for years without issue.

I can reliably receive and view messages, but after carefully checking all IMAP & STMP server settings, remain unable to send any outgoing messages for past couple of weeks.

I do not own a mobile phone to be able to receive temporary codes or do any type of two-step authentication.

When attempting to send messages, here are the repeated error messages leading to endless loop that eventually times out:

Login to account "Microsoft" failed Login to server smtp.office365.com with username xxxx@outlook.com failed.

Send Message Error Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com timed out. Try again.

Send Message Error Sending of the message failed. Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com. Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account Settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)'.


Current Server Settings:

IMAP Mail Server outlook.office365.com Port 993 xxxx@outlook.com SSL/TLS OAuth2

Default Outgoing Server (Microsoft) smtp.office365.com Port 587 xxxx@outlook.com STARTTLS OAuth2

No so-called 'solutions' that are currently online have any effect. What do you suggest? Thanks!

title: Can see notifications from mail on other profile
content:
Having recently upgraded to thunderbird:amd64 (1:115.1 5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1, 1:115.16.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1), on Linux Mint 20.2, I am seeing an unusual issue.

The problem i have is that I originally had 2 profiles for work/home. I can now see my work messages when *not* signed into my work email nor is the password supposed to be saved when I sign out of that account.

The emails appear up as desktop notifications when I am on my home profile, I can see the title and some of the first line of the email. I didn't enter my password for my work email, nor is it saved, so it shouldn't be stored - but somehow it is persisting through restarts?

I also don't see the profile manager at startup anymore, and have to start thunderbird with the --ProfileManager option to be able to see this window - even though the "use the selected profile without asking at startup" is not selected.

Has anyone seen this before, or have any ideas?

title: Empty e-mails in Inbox on Local Folders - Please HELP!
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for over 15 years, 2 days ago I went to check my e-mails, new e-mails have downloaded and I can see them just fine, but 99.9% of my older e-mails are empty. The subject line for all of my e-mails is there, but when you click on it, the e-mail is completely empty. I have e-mails from 2009 in my inbox, and when i click on some of them, it shows the e-mail body, but the e-mail body for -mail from 2009 shows a completely unrelated e-mail I received couple of days ago (Oct 2024). I have checked my backup inbox file, and it's size is about 2Gb, the inbox file on my computer is now 2,500Kb. I am at a complete loss of what happened. Is there any way I can recover my e-mails? I use pop3 account (Gmail) and download all e-mails to my Local Folder (leaving only 2 weeks worth of e-mails on Gmail). This is a complete disaster for me if I can't recover my e-mails, the back up I have is unfortunately too old.

Note: I started having some troubles with auto-compacting my inbox recently. The error message was that there is not enough disk space or something, so I deleted a lot of folders, and run 'compact' function again. It seemed to have reduced Local Folders size, but the e-mails I didn't delete were still there in my inbox. I run McAfee antivirus on my PC, but I did so for many years and there is no quarantined e-mails. The only thing out of the ordinary that happened that day was that I unplugged my computer, and it must have went to sleep mode.

All the subfolders under my Inbox are just fine, I did not compact them separately. I only compacted local folders and inbox.

Does anyone have any ideas of what might have happened and is there any chance/way I can recover my e-mails. Thank you!
creator: Sarah2024

title: Shortcut key for viewing remote content ??
content:
In Evolution, I can hit 'CTL/i' to view remote content in a message, in Thunderbird I have to either authorize a sender (which would then allow ALL of their remote content to be displayed), or use the mouse to allow the content on individual messages (a key-click is SO much more convenient).

Please save me scrolling through pages of shortcuts and just let me know if there is a shortcut key for this function in Thunderbird. Having to use the mouse is a minor annoyance, but it is absolutely an annoyance when one moves over from Evolution.
creator: PeBoVision

title: Happy to announce I reverted back to pre 115 TB (Mac)
content:
Friends: I was running 91.13.1 for the longest time and upgraded to 128 (Nebula) which is a disaster. So many bugs. I kept saying they ruined a great software. E.g., search was totally broken: take forever and doesn't work. Resizing columns is a pain but I realized 115 was the same way.

Challenge: profile gets upgraded too and can't downgrade. But I pulled out backup of a) program b) profile from backup. Replaced everything except the Mail (and its subfolder Local Folders) Replaced the program to 91.13.1 Worked like a champ ~~ upgraded to 115.12.2 - terrible - nicer UI e.g. resizing but same issues as Nebula described above (with columns, search etc.). ~~ downgraded back to 91 - got the profile back upgraded to 102.13.0 Jul 2023: https://thunderbird.en.uptodown.com/mac/download/104978201 (downloaded from: https://thunderbird.en.uptodown.com/mac/versions) ~~~ The designers of this great software broke the UI after 115. Happy to be back at 91.13.1 and won't upgrade for a loooong time, if ever. Best Regards
creator: rezganj

title: Insert links not working
content: I have relied on Thunderbird since Eudora bit the dust, but one aspect that has bugged me(apart from abandoning your beautiful old logo) is the necessity of going through s menu to insert a link. Today, however, when I clicked Insert link nothing happened excerpt that the program hung and I could get out of it only with the Escape key, so there was no way to inert a link. That is the first time it's happened, so I suppose it is a new bug. Please help.
creator: rapsac44

title: Moving Thunderbird to another drive: it finds the accounts but not the local files
content: Up to now Thunderbird was installed on C:, while the profiles directory was on D: (including the local files). As C: was getting saturated, I installed the latest version of Thunderbird on D:, and used the Profile Manager to tell it to load the existing profile. Upon launching Thunderbird, it did find all the connected accounts and connect to them, yet didn't display any local files. However, when I look at the location of the local folders in the new installation, it points to the "old" local folders, D:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\Mail\Local Folders, and all the local files I used to see in the previous installation are there. Yet they don't display in the "new" Thunderbid. How come? What should I do? Thanks for any help.
creator: michaelinparis03

title: Alexa Calendar
content:
It would be nice to be able to link the Thunderbird and ALEXA calendars. I schedule appointments and events from emails and I have Alexa announce my daily schedule so bi-directional updates would be very handy.

I could not find a specific area to submit suggestions.
creator: rrichard39
